intro: Morisonia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
